str2: A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: From para and didomi; to surrender, i.e yield up, intrust, transmit.
A brother, member of the same religious community, especially a fellow-Christian. A brother near or remote.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
Death, physical or spiritual. From thnesko; death.
Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Plural
str2: Intrans. tenses: I rise up against. Middle voice from epi and anistemi; to stand up on, i.e. to attack.
On, to, against, on the basis of, at.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.

parse: Verb - Future Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To put to death, subdue; pass: To be in danger of death, be dead to, be rid of, be parted from. From thanatos to kill.
